intro: Dunalia achalensis, commonly known as the Achalensis Dunalia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of western India. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant is adapted to survive in dry and hot environments, with small, waxy leaves that reduce water loss. It produces small, often yellow or white flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
